overview: From 2026-01-01 to 2026-02-01, elizaos/eliza had 22 new PRs (18 merged), 45 new issues, and 22 active contributors.

topIssues.title: "Reflection evaluator fails with 'Entity not found' - UPDATE_CONTACT requires entity initialization"
topIssues.author: thewoweffect

topIssues.title: Lifecycle & Utilities
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body:
* Add hooks for agent lifecycle management (useAgentList, useStartAgent, useStopAgent).
* Provide mock client for frontend testing without a live server.

topIssues.title: Core Hooks
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body:
* Implement useEliza hook (agent access, plugin state).
* Implement useElizaChat hook (sendMessage, messages, loading, error).

topIssues.title: SDK-first Hooks Mode
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body:
* Support instantiating Eliza directly in browser via hooks (SDK-first, no REST).
* Provide separate server hooks (useElizaServerChat) for REST/SSE integration.

topPRs.title: V2.0.0
topPRs.author: lalalune
topPRs.body:
This is  a working branch of elizaOS v2.0.0

Critically, this removes app, server, CLI and all non-essentials. Instead, we focus on runtime in Rust, Typescript, with critical plugins ported as well

topPRs.title: fix(v2.0.0): Python example testing & fixes
topPRs.author: odilitime
topPRs.body:
- Add Python quickstart documentation (docs/python-quickstart.md) - Fix chat example to include inmemorydb plugin for database support - Add dotenv loading to chat example for .env file support - Fix inmemorydb plugin to use proper Plugin class instead of dict - Fix inmemorydb adapter to accept params dict in get_memories() - Fix inmemorydb adapter to handle Pydantic models in create_memory/update_memory - Fix character provider to use getattr for optional attributes - Add get_available_actions() method to AgentRuntime - Add get_entity() alias method to AgentRuntime - Update get_memories() to accept keyword arguments The Python port had issues because: Plugin export - was a dict instead of Plugin object Method signatures - expected dicts but got Pydantic models No type enforcement - Python doesn't catch these at compile time The Rust type system prevents these bugs automatically. The Python fixes we made bring it to parity with the working Rust implementation. # Risks Medium # Background ## What does this PR do? Fix examples/chat/python ## What kind of change is this? Bug fixes (non-breaking change which fixes an issue) ## Why are we doing this? Any context or related work? Review # Documentation changes needed? maybe --- > [!NOTE] > Introduces true streaming and stabilizes Python runtime/plugins, plus major example and training additions. > > - Adds streaming text APIs: new `ModelType.TEXT_*_STREAM`, `AgentRuntime.use_model_stream()`/`register_streaming_model()`, and `DefaultMessageService.handle_message_stream()` with `StreamingMessageResult` > - OpenAI plugin implements streaming handlers; core exports updated to include streaming types > - Fixes `plugin-inmemorydb`: converted to proper `Plugin`, adapter now accepts `params`/kwargs, handles Pydantic models (camelCase keys), and corrects pagination/filters > - Hardens character provider to safely access optional fields via `getattr` > - AgentRuntime enhancements: `get_available_actions()`, `get_entity()` alias, `get_memories()` kwargs support > - A2A FastAPI server uses true token-by-token SSE streaming and includes `inmemorydb`; requirements updated > - Chat example loads `.env` and includes `inmemorydb` plugin > - ART Tic‑Tac‑Toe: adds heuristic agent, refines config (`opponent`, `ai_player`), winner/draw handling, and CLI updates > - New Atropos TextWorld package: environment/agents, trajectory + tokenizer tooling, offline data generation, BaseEnv factory, and CLI; README expanded > - Core Python README and example docs updated for setup and usage > > Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 21f8c31fc22b7778f998d85c754ee82a0a8e2253. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).

Greptile Overview

### Greptile Summary This PR fixes the Python chat example and inmemorydb plugin to work together, adds Python quickstart documentation, and improves Character attribute handling. The changes include: **Key Improvements:** - Adds comprehensive Python quickstart documentation with examples - Fixes inmemorydb plugin to use proper Plugin class instead of dict - Enhances inmemorydb adapter to handle Pydantic models in create_memory/update_memory - Updates character provider to safely access optional attributes with getattr() - Adds dotenv support to chat example for .env file loading - Adds useful helper methods to AgentRuntime (get_available_actions, get_entity alias) - Enhances get_memories() to accept keyword arguments **Critical Issues Found:** 1. **Bug in adapter.py line 329**: The update_memory() method references the wrong variable name (`memory` instead of `memory_dict`), which will cause AttributeError when processing Pydantic models 2. **Bug in character.py lines 70-73**: Inconsistent attribute access - uses getattr() in function body but direct access in return data dict, causing AttributeError for optional attributes 3. **Missing dependency in chat.py**: Imports python-dotenv but it's not in requirements.txt 4. **Incomplete documentation**: Quickstart guide doesn't include inmemorydb plugin installation that the chat example now requires **Impact:** The bugs in adapter.py and character.py are critical and will cause runtime errors. The missing dependencies will prevent users from running the example successfully. ### Confidence Score: 1/5 - This PR contains critical bugs that will cause runtime failures and prevent the chat example from working - Score reflects two critical logic errors (wrong variable reference in adapter.py:329 and inconsistent attribute access in character.py:70-73) plus missing dependencies that will cause import errors. These issues will break the example for users and cause AttributeErrors at runtime. - Pay close attention to plugins/plugin-inmemorydb/python/elizaos_plugin_inmemorydb/adapter.py (line 329 bug), packages/python/elizaos/bootstrap/providers/character.py (lines 70-73 inconsistency), and examples/chat/python/chat.py (missing python-dotenv dependency)

Important Files Changed

File Analysis | Filename | Score | Overview | |----------|-------|----------| | docs/python-quickstart.md | 3/5 | New documentation file added. Missing plugin-inmemorydb installation instruction that the chat example now requires. | | examples/chat/python/chat.py | 2/5 | Added dotenv and inmemorydb support. Missing python-dotenv dependency in requirements, which will cause import errors. | | packages/python/elizaos/bootstrap/providers/character.py | 2/5 | Fixed to use getattr for optional character attributes. Critical bug: return data dict directly accesses attributes without getattr, causing AttributeError. | | plugins/plugin-inmemorydb/python/elizaos_plugin_inmemorydb/adapter.py | 1/5 | Enhanced get_memories(), create_memory(), and update_memory() to handle Pydantic models. Critical bug in update_memory line 329: uses wrong variable name. |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant User participant chat.py participant dotenv participant AgentRuntime participant OpenAIPlugin participant InMemoryDBPlugin participant InMemoryAdapter participant CharacterProvider User->>chat.py: Run python chat.py chat.py->>dotenv: load_dotenv(env_path) dotenv-->>chat.py: Load .env from repo root chat.py->>AgentRuntime: Create with character and plugins AgentRuntime->>OpenAIPlugin: Initialize OpenAI plugin AgentRuntime->>InMemoryDBPlugin: Initialize InMemoryDB plugin InMemoryDBPlugin->>InMemoryAdapter: create_database_adapter(agent_id) InMemoryAdapter-->>InMemoryDBPlugin: Return adapter instance InMemoryDBPlugin->>AgentRuntime: register_database_adapter(adapter) AgentRuntime->>CharacterProvider: get_character_context() CharacterProvider->>CharacterProvider: Use getattr() for optional attributes CharacterProvider-->>AgentRuntime: Return character context AgentRuntime-->>chat.py: Runtime initialized User->>chat.py: Type message chat.py->>AgentRuntime: handle_message(runtime, memory) AgentRuntime->>InMemoryAdapter: get_memories(params) InMemoryAdapter-->>AgentRuntime: Return memories AgentRuntime->>OpenAIPlugin: Generate response OpenAIPlugin-->>AgentRuntime: Return response AgentRuntime->>InMemoryAdapter: create_memory(memory_dict) InMemoryAdapter-->>AgentRuntime: Memory stored AgentRuntime-->>chat.py: Return result chat.py-->>User: Display response ``` ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **New Features** * In-memory database plugin for agent memory. * Token-by-token streaming for chat responses and streaming endpoints. * Atropos data-generation, trajectory tooling, and TextWorld agent integrations. * New Tic‑Tac‑Toe AI/player options and interactive configuration. * **Documentation** * Expanded developer setup, examples, runnable chat walkthroughs, and new Atropos CLI flags. * **Other** * Updated Python packaging/requirements and repository-root .env loading for examples. ✏️ Tip: You can customize this high-level summary in your review settings.

topPRs.title: fix: plugin-bootstrap (+ sql minor) actions/providers for serverId => messageServerId change
topPRs.author: odilitime
topPRs.body:
# Risks Low # Background ## What does this PR do? ## What kind of change is this? Bug fixes (non-breaking change which fixes an issue) ## Why are we doing this? Any context or related work? User reports of 1.7.0 not working with plugin-discord 1.3.3 # Documentation changes needed? My changes do not require a change to the project documentation. --- > [!NOTE] > **Adds onboarding and role management, refactors providers, and updates schema** > > - New `UPDATE_SETTINGS` action: extracts multiple settings, persists to `world.metadata.settings` with salting/unsalting, generates success/failure/error responses, and completes onboarding when required settings are done > - New/updated `SETTINGS` provider: reads/decrypts settings from world metadata, supports onboarding (DM) vs regular contexts, and outputs concise status with guidance > - New/updated `WORLD` provider: surfaces world/room/channel/participant summaries and structured channel categorization for prompts > - New `UPDATE_ROLE` action: parses XML for role assignments, enforces permission rules, updates `world.metadata.roles`, and persists via `updateWorld` > - Tests: comprehensive event lifecycle and reaction handling, entity join/leave, and platform-agnostic `shouldRespond` mention/reply logic > - SQL: `packages/plugin-sql/src/schema/room.ts` now defines `messageServerId` as `uuid('message_server_id')` (doc/comment cleanup) > > Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 25d98528e8c98217fbaa63a5e430202a575800e6. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).

Greptile Summary

Completes the migration from deprecated `serverId` to `messageServerId` across plugin-bootstrap actions/providers and plugin-sql schema. **Key Changes:** - Updated `packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/actions/roles.ts` validate function to check `room.messageServerId` instead of accessing `message.content.serverId` - Updated logger metadata keys from `serverId` to `messageServerId` in actions/settings.ts, providers/settings.ts, and action return data in roles.ts - Updated provider output in providers/world.ts to use `messageServerId` field name - Updated JSDoc comment in plugin-sql schema to reflect the correct column name - Updated test mocks and fixtures to use `messageServerId` This PR addresses user-reported compatibility issues between eliza v1.7.0 and plugin-discord v1.3.3 by ensuring consistent use of the new `messageServerId` field name throughout the codebase. The deprecated `serverId` field still exists in the core types for backward compatibility but is no longer referenced in plugin-bootstrap or plugin-sql.

Confidence Score: 5/5

- This PR is safe to merge with minimal risk - The changes are straightforward field name updates that align with an existing migration (commit 6d1b928c). All changes are consistent, the deprecated field remains in core types for backward compatibility, and the PR only updates references in plugin-bootstrap and plugin-sql to use the new field name. The changes fix reported compatibility issues without introducing breaking changes. - No files require special attention

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | packages/plugin-sql/src/schema/room.ts | Updated JSDoc comment from `serverId` to `messageServerId` to match the column definition | | packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/actions/settings.ts | Updated logger metadata keys from `serverId` to `messageServerId` for consistency | | packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/providers/settings.ts | Updated logger metadata key from `serverId` to `messageServerId` for consistency | | packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/providers/world.ts | Updated provider output to use `messageServerId` instead of deprecated `serverId` field | | packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/actions/roles.ts | Refactored validation to check room.messageServerId and updated logger/return data to use `messageServerId` |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant User participant Action as Action/Provider participant Runtime participant Database Note over User,Database: serverId → messageServerId Migration Flow User->>Action: Trigger action (e.g., UPDATE_ROLE) Action->>Runtime: getRoom(roomId) Runtime->>Database: Query room table Database-->>Runtime: Return Room with messageServerId Runtime-->>Action: Room object alt Validate messageServerId exists Action->>Action: Check room.messageServerId Action->>Runtime: getWorld(worldId) Runtime->>Database: Query world Database-->>Runtime: Return World with messageServerId Runtime-->>Action: World object end Action->>Action: Process with world.messageServerId Action->>Runtime: updateWorld(world) Runtime->>Database: Update world metadata Database-->>Runtime: Success Action->>Action: Log with messageServerId key Action-->>User: Return result with messageServerId Note over Action,Database: All references to deprecated serverId
updated to messageServerId ``` ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **Breaking Changes** * Renamed field `serverId` to `messageServerId` across room and world data structures, affecting API responses and database schema. This impacts any code consuming room or world context data. * **Tests** * Updated test utilities and fixtures to reflect the field name change for consistency with production code. ✏️ Tip: You can customize this high-level summary in your review settings.

topPRs.title: feat(v2.0.0): wasm agent runtime
topPRs.author: revlentless
topPRs.body:
# Summary Rust WASM implementation for elizaOS v2.0.0 - enabling the Rust core to run in browser/Node.js environments via WebAssembly. # Risks **Low risk.** This PR: - Makes no breaking API changes to existing Rust code - Uses conditional compilation (`#[cfg]`) so native builds are unaffected - All existing tests continue to pass - Adds new WASM-specific code paths that only activate when building for `wasm32-unknown-unknown` # Background ## What does this PR do? This PR makes the elizaOS Rust core **fully WASM-compatible**, enabling it to run in browsers and Node.js via WebAssembly. The existing Rust crate had WASM bindings but they were stubs - the `WasmAgentRuntime` was a placeholder that didn't actually wrap the real `AgentRuntime`. The key challenge was that Rust's `async_trait` and many traits require `Send + Sync` bounds for thread-safety, but WASM is single-threaded and doesn't support these traits. This PR implements platform-aware macros and conditional compilation to provide the correct bounds for each target. ### Key Changes #### 1. Platform-Aware Macros (`src/platform.rs`) ```rust // Native: #[async_trait] (requires Send) // WASM: #[async_trait(?Send)] (no Send requirement) platform_async_trait! { pub trait MyTrait { ... } } // Native: pub trait MyTrait: Send + Sync { ... } // WASM: pub trait MyTrait { ... } define_platform_trait! { pub trait MyTrait { ... } } ``` #### 2. Core Trait Migration All core traits now compile for both targets: - `ActionHandler`, `ProviderHandler`, `EvaluatorHandler` - `DatabaseAdapter`, `Service`, `IAgentRuntime` - Bootstrap traits: `Action`, `Provider`, `Evaluator`, `Service` #### 3. Real WasmAgentRuntime The `WasmAgentRuntime` now wraps the actual `AgentRuntime` using WASM-appropriate primitives: ```rust pub struct WasmAgentRuntime { inner: Rc>>, // Not Arc - WASM is single-threaded character: RefCell, agent_id: UUID, } ``` #### 4. Structured WASM Errors Rich error objects for JavaScript consumers: ```rust pub struct WasmError { pub code: String, // "VALIDATION_ERROR", "RUNTIME_ERROR", etc. pub message: String, // Human-readable message pub source: Option, // Field/component that caused error } ``` #### 5. JavaScript Shims Type-safe wrappers for JS callbacks: ```rust pub struct JsModelHandler { js_object: JsValue, handle_func: Function, } ``` #### 6. Bug Fix: ChannelType Serialization Fixed `ChannelType` enum to serialize correctly: - Before: `VoiceDm` → `"VOICEDM"` ❌ - After: `VoiceDm` → `"VOICE_DM"` ✅ ## What kind of change is this? - **Features** (non-breaking change which adds functionality) - **Bug fixes** (ChannelType serialization) - **Improvements** (structured errors, better WASM integration) # Documentation changes needed? My changes require a change to the project documentation: - Added `examples/README.md` with usage instructions for native and WASM examples - WASM module includes JSDoc comments for all exports # Testing ## Where should a reviewer start? 1. `src/platform.rs` - Platform macros (foundation of the approach) 2. `src/types/components.rs` - Core handler traits with conditional compilation 3. `src/wasm/mod.rs` - WasmAgentRuntime implementation 4. `__tests__/wasm/` - TypeScript tests verifying WASM bindings ## Detailed testing steps ### Native Tests (Rust) ```bash cd packages/rust cargo test --features native # Expected: 79 tests pass ``` ### WASM Binding Tests (TypeScript/Vitest) ```bash cd packages/rust npx vitest run __tests__/wasm/wasm-bindings.test.ts # Expected: 16 tests pass ``` ### Full Test Suite ```bash cd packages/rust ./run-all-tests.sh # Expected: 108 passed, 0 failed, 2 skipped ``` ### Native Examples ```bash cargo run --example basic_runtime --features native cargo run --example with_handlers --features native ``` ### WASM Examples (Bun) ```bash bun run examples/wasm/basic.ts bun run examples/wasm/runtime.ts bun run examples/wasm/chat.ts # Interactive ``` ## Test Coverage | Suite | Tests | Status | |-------|-------|--------| | Rust native (`cargo test`) | 79 | ✅ | | WASM bindings (Vitest) | 16 | ✅ | | Interop equivalence (Vitest) | 16 | ✅ | | Python serialization | 22 | ✅ | | **Total** | **133** | ✅ | # Commits | Commit | Description | |--------|-------------| | `2ea503d` | feat(rust): improved WASM foundation with structured errors and JS shims | | `d00b690` | chore(rust): add wasm-test.sh for running WASM tests | | `e2b9ff7` | fix(rust): gate tokio tests for native-only, fix WASM test imports | | `f74293d` | feat(rust): add platform-aware macros for native/WASM compatibility | | `90c3e0e` | fix(rust): correct ChannelType serialization to match TypeScript | | `9c87349` | feat(rust): make core traits WASM-compatible | | `fbffb3d` | test(rust): expand WASM test coverage | | `9c3bc11` | test(rust): add WASM tests for platform macros | | `368f0aa` | test(rust): add WASM tests for core handler traits | | `17bfad1` | feat(rust): make all async_trait impls WASM-compatible | | `15c96d4` | feat(rust): upgrade WasmAgentRuntime to wrap real AgentRuntime | | `a4f717e` | test(rust): add comprehensive WASM integration tests | | `629d30a` | style: apply cargo fmt across all files | | `6a58014` | docs(rust): add native and WASM examples | | `85a4043` | fix(rust): fix WASM tests to match Rust type definitions | | `cbaea5a` | fix(rust): fix TypeScript type errors in WASM tests | # Files Changed ``` packages/rust/ ├── src/ │ ├── platform.rs # NEW: Platform macros │ ├── lib.rs # Export platform module │ ├── runtime.rs # Conditional Send+Sync on traits │ ├── types/ │ │ ├── components.rs # ActionHandler, ProviderHandler, EvaluatorHandler │ │ ├── service.rs # Service, TypedService traits │ │ └── environment.rs # ChannelType serialization fix │ ├── bootstrap/ │ │ ├── runtime.rs # IAgentRuntime trait │ │ ├── actions/mod.rs # Action trait │ │ ├── providers/mod.rs # Provider trait │ │ ├── evaluators/mod.rs # Evaluator trait │ │ └── services/mod.rs # Service trait │ └── wasm/ │ ├── mod.rs # WasmAgentRuntime (upgraded) │ ├── error.rs # NEW: WasmError struct │ └── shims/ │ ├── mod.rs # NEW: JS shim exports │ └── model_handler.rs # NEW: JsModelHandler ├── __tests__/ │ └── wasm/ │ ├── wasm-bindings.test.ts # WASM binding tests │ └── interop-equivalence.test.ts # Serialization equivalence tests ├── examples/ │ ├── README.md # NEW: Examples documentation │ ├── basic_runtime.rs # NEW: Native example │ ├── with_handlers.rs # NEW: Native example │ └── wasm/ │ ├── basic.ts # NEW: WASM/Bun example │ ├── runtime.ts # NEW: WASM/Bun example │ └── chat.ts # NEW: Interactive chat example ├── Cargo.toml # Example entries ├── package.json # npm scripts for examples ├── run-all-tests.sh # Updated test runner └── wasm-test.sh # NEW: WASM test script ``` # Architecture ``` ┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐ │ Conditional Compilation │ ├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤ │ #[cfg(not(target_arch = "wasm32"))] │ #[cfg(wasm32)] │ ├───────────────────────────────────────┼─────────────────────┤ │ trait Foo: Send + Sync │ trait Foo │ │ #[async_trait] │ #[async_trait(?Send)]│ │ Arc │ Rc> │ │ tokio runtime │ wasm-bindgen-futures│ └───────────────────────────────────────┴─────────────────────┘ │ ▼ ┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐ │ WasmAgentRuntime │ ├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤ │ inner: Rc>> │ │ │ │ Methods: │ │ - create(character_json) → WasmAgentRuntime │ │ - initialize() → Promise │ │ - handleMessage(msg_json) → Promise │ │ - registerModelHandler(type, JsModelHandler) │ │ - stop() │ └─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘ │ ▼ ┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐ │ JavaScript Usage │ ├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤ │ import { WasmAgentRuntime, JsModelHandler } from 'elizaos';│ │ │ │ const runtime = WasmAgentRuntime.create(characterJson); │ │ await runtime.initialize(); │ │ │ │ runtime.registerModelHandler('TEXT_LARGE', new JsModelHandler({│ │ handle: async (params) => { /* call LLM */ } │ │ })); │ │ │ │ const response = await runtime.handleMessage(messageJson); │ └─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘ ```

# Greptile Summary

- Implements comprehensive WASM compatibility for elizaOS Rust core, enabling the runtime to execute in browsers and Node.js environments via WebAssembly without breaking existing native functionality - Introduces platform-aware macros and conditional compilation patterns to handle Send+Sync trait differences between native (multi-threaded) and WASM (single-threaded) targets - Upgrades `WasmAgentRuntime` from a stub implementation to a fully functional wrapper around the real `AgentRuntime`, with structured error handling, JavaScript interop shims, and comprehensive test coverage # Important Files Changed | Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | `packages/rust/src/platform.rs` | New platform abstraction module providing macros for conditional async_trait bounds and Send+Sync requirements | | `packages/rust/src/wasm/mod.rs` | Upgraded WasmAgentRuntime implementation wrapping real AgentRuntime with WASM-compatible primitives and structured errors | | `packages/rust/src/types/components.rs` | Core handler traits migrated to use platform-aware conditional compilation for ActionHandler, ProviderHandler, and EvaluatorHandler | | `packages/rust/tests/wasm_tests.rs` | New comprehensive WASM test suite with 1506 lines validating cross-platform compatibility and JavaScript interoperability | | `packages/rust/src/types/environment.rs` | Fixed ChannelType serialization to use SCREAMING_SNAKE_CASE format for TypeScript compatibility ("VOICE_DM" instead of "VOICEDM") | # Confidence score: 5/5 - This PR is extremely safe to merge with minimal risk of production issues - Score reflects excellent architectural approach using conditional compilation, comprehensive test coverage (133 tests passing), and non-breaking changes that preserve all native functionality while adding new WASM capabilities - All files demonstrate consistent application of platform-aware patterns with proper error handling and thorough documentation

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant User participant WasmAgentRuntime participant JsModelHandler participant AgentRuntime participant Character participant State participant ModelHandler User->>WasmAgentRuntime: create(characterJson) WasmAgentRuntime->>Character: parse JSON Character-->>WasmAgentRuntime: Character instance WasmAgentRuntime-->>User: WasmAgentRuntime User->>WasmAgentRuntime: initialize() WasmAgentRuntime->>AgentRuntime: new(RuntimeOptions) AgentRuntime-->>WasmAgentRuntime: AgentRuntime instance WasmAgentRuntime-->>User: Promise User->>WasmAgentRuntime: registerModelHandler(type, handler) WasmAgentRuntime->>JsModelHandler: store handler JsModelHandler-->>WasmAgentRuntime: registered User->>WasmAgentRuntime: handleMessage(messageJson) WasmAgentRuntime->>Memory: parse message JSON Memory-->>WasmAgentRuntime: Memory instance WasmAgentRuntime->>AgentRuntime: compose_state(message) AgentRuntime->>State: build state State-->>AgentRuntime: State instance WasmAgentRuntime->>Character: get character data Character-->>WasmAgentRuntime: character info WasmAgentRuntime->>WasmAgentRuntime: build prompt WasmAgentRuntime->>JsModelHandler: call(params) JsModelHandler->>ModelHandler: handle(paramsJson) ModelHandler-->>JsModelHandler: responseJson JsModelHandler-->>WasmAgentRuntime: response text WasmAgentRuntime->>Memory: create response memory Memory-->>WasmAgentRuntime: response memory WasmAgentRuntime-->>User: Promise User->>WasmAgentRuntime: stop() WasmAgentRuntime->>JsModelHandler: clear handlers WasmAgentRuntime->>AgentRuntime: cleanup WasmAgentRuntime-->>User: stopped ```

Context used (3)

 - Context from `dashboard` - CLAUDE.md ([source](https://app.greptile.com/review/custom-context?memory=8ef4c9a3-e221-4aef-8556-8c9b88bf6bbb)) - Context from `dashboard` - .cursorrules ([source](https://app.greptile.com/review/custom-context?memory=00074882-001f-44b1-89c4-859ed3656db9)) - Context from `dashboard` - AGENTS.md ([source](https://app.greptile.com/review/custom-context?memory=51febe90-8918-4f18-be1f-d43bb68d696c))

topPRs.title: refactor(plugin-sql): extract domain stores from BaseDrizzleAdapter
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
Refactors `BaseDrizzleAdapter` (~3,900 lines) into composable domain stores. This improves maintainability, testability, and separation of concerns without changing the public API. ## Changes ### New Domain Stores (`src/stores/`) | Store | Responsibility | Methods | |-------|----------------|---------| | `AgentStore` | Agent CRUD operations | get, getAll, create, update, delete, count | | `MemoryStore` | Memory & embeddings | get, getById, getByIds, create, update, delete, search, count | | `RoomStore` | Room management | getByIds, getByWorld, create, update, delete | | `ParticipantStore` | Room participants | getRoomsForEntity, add, remove, getForRoom, isParticipant, userState | | `EntityStore` | Entity management | getByIds, getForRoom, create, update, delete, getByNames, searchByName | | `ComponentStore` | ECS components | get, getAll, create, update, delete | | `RelationshipStore` | Entity relationships | create, update, get, getAll | | `CacheStore` | Key-value cache | get, set, delete | | `WorldStore` | World management | create, get, getAll, update, delete | | `TaskStore` | Task management | create, getByParams, getByName, get, update, delete | | `LogStore` | Logging & summaries | create, getMany, getAgentRunSummaries, delete | | `MessagingStore` | Servers, channels, messages | createServer, getServers, createChannel, getChannels, createMessage, getMessages, participants | ### Architecture ``` BaseDrizzleAdapter │ ├── initStores() ───────────────────────────────┐ │ │ │ ┌─────────────────────────────────────────┐ │ │ │ StoreContext │◄─┘ │ │ • getDb() │ │ │ • withRetry() │ │ │ • withIsolationContext() │ │ │ • agentId │ │ │ • getEmbeddingDimension() │ │ └─────────────────────────────────────────┘ │ │ │ ┌─────────┴─────────┐ │ ▼ ▼ │ ┌──────────┐ ┌──────────┐ │ │ Store1 │ ... │ StoreN │ │ └──────────┘ └──────────┘ │ └── Public methods delegate to stores ``` ### Key Design Decisions 1. **Shared Context**: All stores receive a `StoreContext` with database access, retry logic, and RLS isolation 2. **No API Changes**: All public methods remain identical - only internal implementation refactored ## Impact - **Lines reduced**: `base.ts` from ~3,900 to ~1,350 lines (~65% reduction) - **Files added**: 13 new files in `src/stores/` - **Public API**: No changes - **Tests**: All 160 unit + all integration tests pass (PGLite + PostgreSQL) ## Testing ```bash # Unit tests bun run test:unit # 160 pass # Integration tests (PGLite) bun run test:integration # All pass # Integration tests (PostgreSQL) bun run test:integration:postgres # All pass (including RLS tests) ``` ## Migration No migration needed - this is a pure refactoring with no public API changes.

Greptile Summary

- Refactors monolithic `BaseDrizzleAdapter` class (~3,900 lines) into 11 focused domain stores in `packages/plugin-sql/src/stores/` to improve maintainability and testability while preserving the exact same public API - Introduces `StoreContext` pattern that provides shared database access, retry logic, and Row Level Security isolation to all domain stores, maintaining consistency across the codebase - Implements comprehensive CRUD operations across stores for agents, memories, rooms, participants, entities, components, relationships, caching, worlds, tasks, and logging

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | packages/plugin-sql/src/base.ts | Refactored from ~3,900 to ~1,350 lines by extracting domain logic into stores and adding delegation methods | | packages/plugin-sql/src/stores/memory.store.ts | New store handling memory CRUD, vector embeddings, and similarity search operations | | packages/plugin-sql/src/stores/entity.store.ts | New store for entity management including component aggregation and name-based searching | | packages/plugin-sql/src/stores/log.store.ts | New store with complex agent run summaries and JSON sanitization for logging operations |

Confidence score: 4/5

- This is a well-executed refactoring with comprehensive testing and minimal risk due to preserved public API - Score lowered due to minor issues: unused parameter in TaskStore.getAll(), missing agent ID filter in TaskStore.delete(), and complex field mapping logic in RelationshipStore that could be simplified - No files require special attention - the refactoring successfully maintains API compatibility while improving code organization

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Client as "Client" participant Adapter as "BaseDrizzleAdapter" participant StoreContext as "StoreContext" participant MemoryStore as "MemoryStore" participant Manager as "ConnectionManager" participant DB as "Database" Note over Client,DB: Memory Search Flow (Primary Happy Path) Client->>Adapter: searchMemoriesByEmbedding(embedding, params) Adapter->>Adapter: withDatabase(() => operation()) Adapter->>MemoryStore: searchByEmbedding(embedding, params) MemoryStore->>StoreContext: withRetry(() => operation()) StoreContext->>MemoryStore: Execute operation MemoryStore->>StoreContext: getDb() StoreContext->>MemoryStore: Return database instance MemoryStore->>DB: Execute cosine distance query with conditions DB-->>MemoryStore: Return matching memories with similarity scores MemoryStore->>MemoryStore: Transform results to Memory objects MemoryStore-->>StoreContext: Return transformed memories StoreContext-->>Adapter: Return memories Adapter-->>Client: Return Memory[] Note over Client,DB: Memory Creation Flow Client->>Adapter: createMemory(memory, tableName) Adapter->>Adapter: withDatabase(() => operation()) Adapter->>MemoryStore: create(memory, tableName) MemoryStore->>StoreContext: withIsolationContext(entityId, callback) StoreContext->>Manager: withIsolationContext(entityId, callback) Manager->>DB: Set RLS context for entity Manager->>MemoryStore: Execute callback with transaction MemoryStore->>DB: Insert memory record MemoryStore->>MemoryStore: upsertEmbedding(tx, memoryId, embedding) MemoryStore->>DB: Insert/Update embedding record DB-->>MemoryStore: Return inserted memory ID MemoryStore-->>StoreContext: Return memory ID StoreContext-->>Adapter: Return memory ID Adapter-->>Client: Return UUID Note over Client,DB: Agent Operations Flow Client->>Adapter: getAgent(agentId) Adapter->>Adapter: withDatabase(() => operation()) Adapter->>AgentStore: get(agentId) AgentStore->>StoreContext: withRetry(() => operation()) AgentStore->>StoreContext: getDb() StoreContext->>AgentStore: Return database instance AgentStore->>DB: SELECT from agents WHERE id = agentId DB-->>AgentStore: Return agent record AgentStore->>AgentStore: Transform to Agent object AgentStore-->>Adapter: Return Agent Adapter-->>Client: Return Agent ```

Context used (3)

 - Context from `dashboard` - CLAUDE.md ([source](https://app.greptile.com/review/custom-context?memory=8ef4c9a3-e221-4aef-8556-8c9b88bf6bbb)) - Context from `dashboard` - .cursorrules ([source](https://app.greptile.com/review/custom-context?memory=00074882-001f-44b1-89c4-859ed3656db9)) - Context from `dashboard` - AGENTS.md ([source](https://app.greptile.com/review/custom-context?memory=51febe90-8918-4f18-be1f-d43bb68d696c))

completedItems.title: fix(plugin-sql): use sql.raw() for SET LOCAL to avoid parameterizatio…
completedItems.body:
PostgreSQL SET commands do not support parameterized queries. The previous
implementation used Drizzle's sql tagged template which auto-parameterizes
values, causing "syntax error at or near $1" when ENABLE_DATA_ISOLATION=true.

- Chang

completedItems.title: test(plugin-sql): use withEntityContext in RLS tests + isolation in CI
completedItems.body:
## Summary

- Use `withEntityContext()` in RLS tests instead of raw `pg.Client`
- Add `ENABLE_DATA_ISOLATION=true` to CI
- Remove redundant `withEntityContext.test.ts`

Ensures CI catches the `$1` parameterization bug if it regresses.

topContributors.summary: standujar: Focused on strengthening the database infrastructure and security within the elizaos/eliza repository, most notably by implementing Neon serverless support and enhancing Row Level Security (RLS) schemas in PR #6343. They demonstrated a significant commitment to system reliability by contributing over 7,700 lines of test code to isolate RLS contexts (PR #6330) and addressing compatibility issues for PGLite (PR #6339). Beyond these merged improvements, they worked on optimizing runtime initialization through parallelization and provided technical feedback via 11 total reviews and comments. Their primary focus this month was on bug fixes and extensive test coverage, particularly within the SQL plugin architecture.

0xbbjoker: Focused on enhancing database reliability and performance within the elizaos/eliza repository, notably resolving a critical SQL parameterization issue in the SQL plugin via PR #6316 (+278/-1 lines). They further contributed to system scalability by proposing a new LRU caching layer for the database adapter in PR #6329 and maintained high code quality through two peer reviews. Their work involved extensive modifications across 378 files, demonstrating a significant commitment to bug fixes and testing infrastructure. Overall, their primary focus this month was on stabilizing and optimizing core database plugins and backend configurations.

wtfsayo: Focused on enhancing infrastructure stability and database reliability, notably delivering a significant overhaul to the SQL plugin in elizaos/eliza (#6323) that introduced critical pool configurations and error handling. They also modernized the project's CI/CD pipeline by upgrading Claude workflows to Opus 4.5 and enabling automated bot triggers (#6324, #6328). Across 45 commits, they managed extensive modifications to nearly 400 files, demonstrating a high-impact focus on bug fixes and configuration management. Their primary contributions centered on improving system resilience through robust database integration and automated workflow optimizations.

greptile-apps: Focused exclusively on providing feedback and guidance through 14 code reviews and 4 pull request comments this month. Despite having no direct code changes or merged pull requests, they maintained a consistent presence in the review process to support team contributions. Their primary impact was centered on collaborative oversight and technical discussion within the pull request workflow.

madjin: Focused on expanding the functionality and user experience of the project's web presence, most notably by implementing a comprehensive MMORPG-style character system for the leaderboard API in elizaos/elizaos.github.io #193. This substantial contribution involved over 2,800 lines of code and established a foundation for complex features like class evolution and visual identity systems, which they further detailed through 11 new feature requests and bug reports. Beyond these gamification enhancements, they improved site accessibility by adding an XSL stylesheet for browser-rendered RSS feeds in #188 and identified critical performance bottlenecks regarding memory consumption in the build process. Their work this month primarily centered on feature development and configuration, significantly advancing the project's interactive and data-driven capabilities.

odilitime: Focused on enhancing core plugin functionality and build system efficiency, notably merging a substantial update to the bootstrap plugin and SQL actions in elizaos/eliza (#6333) that involved over 6,900 lines of code changes. They also addressed infrastructure performance by optimizing build task inputs in turbo.json (#6349) and triaged a regression in Discord slash commands (elizaos-plugins/plugin-discord#15). Their work this month demonstrates a strong emphasis on system stability and configuration, with a primary focus on bug fixes and architectural improvements across code and test files.

1bcMax: Focused on expanding payment capabilities within the ecosystem by initiating the implementation of the plugin-blockrun for x402 micropayments in elizaos/eliza (#6355). This substantial feature addition involved over 1,000 lines of new code across 11 files, demonstrating a significant investment in building out financial infrastructure. The work shows a comprehensive approach to development, with a balanced focus on core feature logic, testing, and configuration.

borisudovicic: Focused on refining the user experience and product logic for the Eliza platform, driving the resolution of 18 issues related to agent discovery, chat interface usability, and credit management. They played a key role in defining the "SDK-first Hooks Mode" (#5966) and "Core Hooks" (#5928) architecture while overseeing critical UI/UX polish, such as optimizing chat box dynamics (#6310) and improving the agent creation workflow (#6306, #6307). Their contributions centered on streamlining the onboarding process for non-signed-up users (#6312, #6353) and enhancing the public agent ecosystem through better state separation and knowledge transfer (#6313, #6303). Overall, their activity focused on product management and quality assurance to ensure a cohesive and scalable agent-building experience.

lalalune: Focused on a massive structural overhaul of the codebase, primarily driven by the ongoing development of the "V2.0.0" release in elizaos/eliza (#6351). This high-impact effort involved 191 commits and extensive modifications across over 33,000 files, signaling a comprehensive restructuring of the project's architecture. Their work demonstrated a balanced commitment to stability and quality, with a primary focus on bugfixes, configuration updates, and core code enhancements.

rejected-l: Focused on administrative maintenance within the elizaos/eliza repository, specifically ensuring legal compliance by updating the project's licensing information. They successfully merged PR #6301 to update the license year, demonstrating attention to project documentation and upkeep. This work involved minor adjustments across two files, reflecting a primary focus on general repository maintenance and chore-related tasks.

linear: Focused on architectural improvements and system stability by identifying and documenting critical technical enhancements across the elizaos/eliza repository. They prioritized core infrastructure by proposing solutions for JWT authentication (#6327), message processing parallelization (#6337), and runtime initialization optimization (#6334). Their contributions also addressed immediate reliability issues, including a fix for double processing in the Messaging API (#6298) and resolving a race condition in credit deduction (#6338). Overall, their focus remained on high-level system design, database query patterns, and backend security.

takasaki404: Focused on ecosystem expansion by initiating the integration of new tools into the plugin registry. They submitted a configuration update in elizaos-plugins/registry (#247) to add the @zane-archer/plugin-aimo-router package. This contribution was centered entirely on registry management and configuration maintenance.

kamiyo-ai: Focused on expanding the ecosystem by initiating the integration of a new plugin into the registry. This effort is centered on the submission of PR #246 in elizaos-plugins/registry to add the @kamiyo/eliza plugin. Their primary focus this month has been on plugin registration and ecosystem contribution.

ChristopherTrimboli: Focused on quality assurance and peer collaboration this month, contributing through the review and approval of two pull requests. Their involvement centered on providing oversight and validation for team contributions rather than direct code implementation. This activity reflects a focus on maintaining project standards through the code review process.

samarth30: Focused on project expansion by proposing a new "Apps promotion" feature for the elizaos/eliza repository. This contribution involved identifying a growth opportunity and documenting the requirement in issue #6341. Their primary focus this month was on feature ideation and initial project planning.

GarrickBrown: Focused on identifying and reporting stability issues within the Telegram plugin ecosystem. They documented a critical TypeError occurring during image processing, opening issue #23 in elizaos-plugins/plugin-telegram to facilitate a fix for the crashing bug. Their primary focus this month was on bug reporting and improving the reliability of plugin-based image handling.
